paper_abstract: The rise of dark silicon is driving a new class of architectural techniques that "spend" area to "buy" energy efficiency. This article examines four recently proposed directions ("the four horsemen") for adapting to dark silicon, outlines a set of evolutionary dark silicon design principles, and shows how one of the darkest computing architectures-the human brain-offers insights into more revolutionary directions for computer architecture.
paper_title: A LANDSCAPE OF THE NEW DARK SILICON DESIGN REGIME
